item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 16, 2009, 07:30:08 pm[/size][hr][quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:256848”]probably

int max = 0;
int current = //however you get it
while (current > 1) {
  if (current > max) {
    max = current;
  }
  current = next(current);
}[/code][/quote]

ombyic... [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 16, 2009, 07:42:23 pm[/size][hr]yea, solved thanks. why i was trying to overcomplecate it idk.

[code]public void generateStats()
   {
      int max = 0;
      int original = this.getStart(); //create instance variable? or is it pointless and i should just call this.getStart below
      int current = this.next(original);
      int length = 1;
      
      while (current > 1) {
         if (current > max) {
            max = current;
         } 
         current = this.next(current);
         length++;
      }
            System.out.print("max =" + max + ",");
            System.out.print("length =" + length);
  
}

[code]Wonder mg = new Wonder(6);
mg.printSequence();
mg.generateStats();

3,10,5,16,8,4,2,1,max =16,length =8
[/code]

item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

just do

int max = 0; for(int current : this.getSequence()) { //create a method similar to this.printSequence() but returns an int[] if(current > max) max = current; }

unless i am mis-understanding what you are asking…

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

sorry, im trying to find the max value in the sequence result;

this.printSequence() would generate printed results for the argument, eg for 6

6, 3, 10, 5, 16, 8, 2, 1

i need to find the highest number in this sequence, i guess i need to store all the results but it could be endless… (may not be true)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 16, 2009, 07:04:44 pm[/size][hr]this rule for the number 27 has maybe 100 numbers in the sequence. im supposed to be able to count the number of results and find the highest value result

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

again please, preferably direction to reading material but w/e…

below is a wondrous sequence class. I have been asked to write the three methods below, next, printSequence (which states the result must be printed not stored) and generateStats. We are told generateStats should calculate the sequence in the same way printSequence does, but instead of printing the results should be stored and then all results from the sequence must have the highest number and the number of results returned as ‘max’ and ‘length’.

Im stumped how i should be catching each number in the sequence and comparing it using the concept i currently use in printSequence (which does what it should). I should be comparing against the last stored value and store if higher? or should i be creating an array of the sequence and then examining the array for the required values?

sorry for rambling, its late. As i said reading direction would be great

[code]import ou.*;

/**

  • Class Wonder - An instance of class Wonder represents a wondrous sequence of integers.
  • A wondrous sequence starts with a positive integer. If a number in the sequence is even
  • then the next number is obtained by dividing the current number by 2 otherwise the next
  • number is obtained by multiplying the current number by 3 and then adding 1. Rather than
  • hold the whole sequence, an instance of Wonder provides information about the sequence
  • and a method that calculates and outputs the whole sequence.

*/
-snip-

/**
* Returns the next number after aNumber in a wondrous sequence
*/
public static int next(int aNumber)
{
if (aNumber % 2 == 0){ //even
aNumber = aNumber / 2;
}
else { //if (aNumber % 2 != 0){
aNumber = ((aNumber * 3) + 1);
}
return aNumber;
}

/**
* Outputs to the standard output the actual wondrous sequence
* of numbers starting at the number start.
*/
public void printSequence()

{
int original = this.getStart(); //create instance variable? or is it pointless and i should just call this.getStart below
int current = this.next(original);
System.out.print(current + “,”);
while (current > 1){
current = this.next(current);
System.out.print(current + “,”);
}
}

/**
* Sets the instance variables length and max to the values
* pertaining to the wondrous sequence starting at start.
* Returns the receiver.
*/
public void generateStats()
{
// int original = this.getStart(); //create instance variable? or is it pointless and i should just call this.getStart below
// int current = this.next(original);
// while (current > 1){
// int max = Math.max(this.next(current), original);
// System.out.print(max);

//  }

}
-snip-
[/code]
